Feb 23 - Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners, an investment management firm focused on renewables, storage and grid support infrastructure, has appointed John Lucas as senior director of data strategies. Lucas joins from Amazon Web Services (AWS) where he was head of renewables and energy procurement for the Americas. In 2021, AWS committed to over 6.2GW of renewables power purchase agreements (PPAs) under Lucas' leadership. Prior to AWS, Lucas held energy procurement roles at Facebook and traded energy and power at Morgan Stanley, Puget Sound Energy and Shell. At Quinbrook he will lead the firm’s green data centre efforts with a focus on Rowan in the US, a joint venture between Quinbrook and Birch Infrastructure to develop and construct renewables-powered data centres, and Quinbrook’s data centre campus in advanced development in Australia. He will also join Rowan’s board of directors.

(Alison Healey)
